00026 #include "lpc17xx_i2c.h"

00031 /* Example group ----------------------------------------------------------- */
00037 /************************** PRIVATE DEFINITIONS *************************/
00039 #define USEDI2CDEV_M            2
00040 
00042 #define USEDI2CDEV_S            0
00043 
00044 #define I2CDEV_S_OWN_ADDR       (0x90>>1)
00045 
00047 #define BUFFER_SIZE                     0x10
00048 
00049 
00050 #if (USEDI2CDEV_M == USEDI2CDEV_S)
00051 #error "Master and Slave I2C device are duplicated!"
00052 #endif
00053 
00054 #if (USEDI2CDEV_M == 0)
00055 #define I2CDEV_M LPC_I2C0
00056 #elif (USEDI2CDEV_M == 2)
00057 #define I2CDEV_M LPC_I2C2
00058 #else
00059 #error "Master I2C device not defined!"
00060 #endif
00061 
00062 
00063 #if (USEDI2CDEV_S == 0)
00064 #define I2CDEV_S LPC_I2C0
00065 #elif (USEDI2CDEV_S == 2)
00066 #define I2CDEV_S LPC_I2C2
00067 #else
00068 #error "Slave I2C device not defined!"
00069 #endif
00070 
00071 /************************** PRIVATE VARIABLES *************************/
00072 uint8_t menu1[] =
00073 "********************************************************************************\n\r"
00074 "Hello NXP Semiconductors \n\r"
00075 "I2C demo \n\r"
00076 "\t - MCU: LPC17xx \n\r"
00077 "\t - Core: ARM Cortex-M3 \n\r"
00078 "\t - This example uses two I2C peripheral, one set as master and \n\r"
00079 "\t the other set as slave \n\r"
00080 "\t First, the master send 16 bytes of data to slave \n\r"
00081 "\t Then, the master receive 16 bytes of data from slave \n\r"
00082 "\t Both of them used in interrupt mode \n\r"
00083 "********************************************************************************\n\r";
00084 
00086 __IO FlagStatus complete_M;
00087 uint8_t Master_Buf[BUFFER_SIZE];
00088 
00089 
00091 __IO FlagStatus complete_S;
00092 uint8_t Slave_Buf[BUFFER_SIZE];
00093 
00094 
00095 uint8_t master_test[2];
00096 uint8_t slave_test[2];

00099 /* Interrupt service routines */
00100 #if ((USEDI2CDEV_M == 0) || (USEDI2CDEV_S == 0))
00101 void I2C0_IRQHandler(void);
00102 #endif
00103 #if ((USEDI2CDEV_M == 2) || (USEDI2CDEV_S == 2))
00104 void I2C2_IRQHandler(void);

00112 #if ((USEDI2CDEV_M == 0) || (USEDI2CDEV_S == 0))
00113 /*----------------- INTERRUPT SERVICE ROUTINES --------------------------*/
00114 /*********************************************************************/
00119 void I2C0_IRQHandler(void)
00120 {
00121 #if (USEDI2CDEV_M == 0)
00122         I2C_MasterHandler(I2CDEV_M);
00123         if (I2C_MasterTransferComplete(I2CDEV_M)){
00124                 complete_M = SET;
00125         }
00126 #endif
00127 
00128 #if (USEDI2CDEV_S == 0)
00129         I2C_SlaveHandler(I2CDEV_S);
00130         if (I2C_SlaveTransferComplete(I2CDEV_S)){
00131                 complete_S = SET;
00132         }
00133 #endif
00134 }
00135 #endif /* ((USEDI2CDEV_M == 0) || (USEDI2CDEV_S == 0)) */
00136 
00137 
00138 #if ((USEDI2CDEV_M == 2) || (USEDI2CDEV_S == 2))
00139 
00140 /*********************************************************************/
00145 void I2C2_IRQHandler(void)
00146 {
00147 #if (USEDI2CDEV_M == 2)
00148         I2C_MasterHandler(I2CDEV_M);
00149         if (I2C_MasterTransferComplete(I2CDEV_M)){
00150                 complete_M = SET;
00151         }
00152 #endif
00153 #if (USEDI2CDEV_S == 2)
00154         I2C_SlaveHandler(I2CDEV_S);
00155         if (I2C_SlaveTransferComplete(I2CDEV_S)){
00156                 complete_S = SET;
00157         }
00158 #endif
00159 }
00160 #endif /* ((USEDI2CDEV_M == 2) || (USEDI2CDEV_S == 2)) */

00168 void print_menu(void)
00169 {
00170         _DBG_(menu1);
00171 }

00173 /*********************************************************************/
00183 void Buffer_Init(uint8_t type)
00184 {
00185         uint8_t i;
00186 
00187         if (type)
00188         {
00189                 for (i = 0; i < BUFFER_SIZE; i++) {
00190                         Master_Buf[i] = 0;
00191                         Slave_Buf[i] = i;
00192                 }
00193         }
00194         else
00195         {
00196                 for (i = 0; i < BUFFER_SIZE; i++) {
00197                         Master_Buf[i] = i;
00198                         Slave_Buf[i] = 0;
00199                 }
00200         }
00201 }
00202

00213          */
00214         while(1);
00215 }

00231 /*-------------------------MAIN FUNCTION------------------------------*/
00232 /*********************************************************************/
00237 int c_entry(void)
00238 {
00239         PINSEL_CFG_Type PinCfg;
00240         I2C_OWNSLAVEADDR_CFG_Type OwnSlavAdr;
00241         I2C_M_SETUP_Type transferMCfg;
00242         I2C_S_SETUP_Type transferSCfg;
00243         uint32_t tempp;
00244         uint8_t *sp, *dp;
00245 
00246         /* Initialize debug via UART0
00247          * – 115200bps
00248          * – 8 data bit
00249          * – No parity
00250          * – 1 stop bit
00251          * – No flow control
00252          */
00253         debug_frmwrk_init();
00254 
00255         //print menu screen
00256         print_menu();
00257 
00258 
00259         /* I2C block ------------------------------------------------------------------- */
00260 
00261         /*
00262          * Init I2C pin connect
00263          */
00264         PinCfg.OpenDrain = 0;
00265         PinCfg.Pinmode = 0;
00266 #if ((USEDI2CDEV_M == 0) || (USEDI2CDEV_S == 0))
00267         PinCfg.Funcnum = 1;
00268         PinCfg.Pinnum = 27;
00269         PinCfg.Portnum = 0;
00270         PINSEL_ConfigPin(&PinCfg);
00271         PinCfg.Pinnum = 28;
00272         PINSEL_ConfigPin(&PinCfg);
00273 #endif
00274 #if ((USEDI2CDEV_M == 2) || (USEDI2CDEV_S == 2))
00275         PinCfg.Funcnum = 2;
00276         PinCfg.Pinnum = 10;
00277         PinCfg.Portnum = 0;
00278         PINSEL_ConfigPin(&PinCfg);
00279         PinCfg.Pinnum = 11;
00280         PINSEL_ConfigPin(&PinCfg);
00281 #endif
00282 
00283         // Initialize Master I2C peripheral
00284         I2C_Init(I2CDEV_M, 100000);
00285         // Initialize Slave I2C peripheral
00286         I2C_Init(I2CDEV_S, 100000);
00287 
00288         /* Set  Own slave address for I2C device */
00289         OwnSlavAdr.GeneralCallState = ENABLE;
00290         OwnSlavAdr.SlaveAddrChannel= 0;
00291         OwnSlavAdr.SlaveAddrMaskValue = 0xFF;
00292         OwnSlavAdr.SlaveAddr_7bit = I2CDEV_S_OWN_ADDR;
00293         I2C_SetOwnSlaveAddr(I2CDEV_S, &OwnSlavAdr);
00294 
00295         /*
00296          * Note: The master should be set higher priority than
00297          * the slave that let interrupt in master can appear
00298          * in slave's timeout condition.
00299          * A higher interrupt priority has lower number level!!!
00300          */
00301 
00302         /* Configure interrupt for I2C in NVIC of ARM core */
00303 #if ((USEDI2CDEV_M == 0) || (USEDI2CDEV_S == 0))
00304     /* Disable I2C0 interrupt */
00305     NVIC_DisableIRQ(I2C0_IRQn);
00306 #if (USEDI2CDEV_M == 0)
00307     /* preemption = 1, sub-priority = 0 */
00308     NVIC_SetPriority(I2C0_IRQn, ((0x00<<3)|0x01));
00309 #else
00310     /* preemption = 1, sub-priority = 2 */
00311     NVIC_SetPriority(I2C0_IRQn, ((0x02<<3)|0x01));
00312 #endif
00313 #endif /* ((USEDI2CDEV_M == 0) || (USEDI2CDEV_S == 0)) */
00314 
00315 #if ((USEDI2CDEV_M == 2) || (USEDI2CDEV_S == 2))
00316     /* Disable I2C2 interrupt */
00317     NVIC_DisableIRQ(I2C2_IRQn);
00318 #if (USEDI2CDEV_M == 2)
00319     /* preemption = 1, sub-priority = 0 */
00320     NVIC_SetPriority(I2C2_IRQn, ((0x00<<3)|0x01));
00321 #else
00322     /* preemption = 1, sub-priority = 2 */
00323     NVIC_SetPriority(I2C2_IRQn, ((0x02<<3)|0x01));
00324 #endif
00325 #endif
00326 
00327 
00328         /* Enable Master I2C operation */
00329         I2C_Cmd(I2CDEV_M, ENABLE);
00330         /* Enable Slave I2C operation */
00331         I2C_Cmd(I2CDEV_S, ENABLE);
00332 
00333 
00334 #if 1
00335         /* MASTER SEND DATA TO SLAVE -------------------------------------------------------- */
00336         /* Force complete flag for the first time of running */
00337         complete_S =  RESET;
00338         complete_M =  RESET;
00339 
00340         _DBG_("Master transmit data to slave...");
00341 
00342         /* Initialize buffer */
00343         Buffer_Init(0);
00344 
00345         /* Start I2C slave device first */
00346         transferSCfg.tx_data = NULL;
00347         transferSCfg.tx_length = 0;
00348         transferSCfg.rx_data = Slave_Buf;
00349         transferSCfg.rx_length = sizeof(Slave_Buf);
00350         I2C_SlaveTransferData(I2CDEV_S, &transferSCfg, I2C_TRANSFER_INTERRUPT);
00351 
00352         /* Then start I2C master device */
00353         transferMCfg.sl_addr7bit = I2CDEV_S_OWN_ADDR;
00354         transferMCfg.tx_data = Master_Buf;
00355         transferMCfg.tx_length = sizeof(Master_Buf);
00356         transferMCfg.rx_data = NULL;
00357         transferMCfg.rx_length = 0;
00358         transferMCfg.retransmissions_max = 3;
00359         I2C_MasterTransferData(I2CDEV_M, &transferMCfg, I2C_TRANSFER_INTERRUPT);
00360 
00361         /* Wait until both of them complete */
00362         while ((complete_M == RESET) || (complete_S == RESET));
00363         // verify data
00364         sp = Master_Buf;
00365         dp = Slave_Buf;
00366         for (tempp = sizeof(Master_Buf); tempp; tempp--){
00367                 if(*sp++ != *dp++){
00368                         _DBG_("Verify data error!");
00369                 }
00370         }
00371         // Success!
00372         if (tempp == 0){
00373                 _DBG_("Verify data successfully!");
00374         }
00375 
00376 
00377         /* MASTER RECEIVE DATA FROM SLAVE -------------------------------------------------------- */
00378         /* Force complete flag for the first time of running */
00379         complete_S =  RESET;
00380         complete_M =  RESET;
00381 
00382         _DBG_("Master read data from slave...");
00383 
00384         /* Initialize buffer */
00385         Buffer_Init(1);
00386 
00387         /* Start I2C slave device first */
00388         transferSCfg.tx_data = Slave_Buf;
00389         transferSCfg.tx_length = sizeof(Slave_Buf);
00390         transferSCfg.rx_data = NULL;
00391         transferSCfg.rx_length = 0;
00392         I2C_SlaveTransferData(I2CDEV_S, &transferSCfg, I2C_TRANSFER_INTERRUPT);
00393 
00394         /* Then start I2C master device */
00395         transferMCfg.sl_addr7bit = I2CDEV_S_OWN_ADDR;
00396         transferMCfg.tx_data = NULL;
00397         transferMCfg.tx_length = 0;
00398         transferMCfg.rx_data = Master_Buf;
00399         transferMCfg.rx_length = sizeof(Master_Buf);
00400         transferMCfg.retransmissions_max = 3;
00401         I2C_MasterTransferData(I2CDEV_M, &transferMCfg, I2C_TRANSFER_INTERRUPT);
00402 
00403         /* Wait until both of them complete */
00404         while ((complete_M == RESET) || (complete_S == RESET));
00405         // verify data
00406         sp = Master_Buf;
00407         dp = Slave_Buf;
00408         for (tempp = sizeof(Master_Buf); tempp; tempp--){
00409                 if(*sp++ != *dp++){
00410                         _DBG_("Verify data error!");
00411                 }
00412         }
00413         // Success!
00414         if (tempp == 0){
00415                 _DBG_("Verify data successfully!");
00416         }
00417 #endif
00418 
00419 
00420 #if 1
00421         // TEST-----------------------------------------------------------
00422         // Master transmit two bytes, then repeat start and reading from slave
00423         // a number of byte
00424         /* Force complete flag for the first time of running */
00425         complete_S =  RESET;
00426         complete_M =  RESET;
00427 
00428         _DBG_("Master transmit data to slave first, then repeat start and read data from slave...");
00429         /* Initialize buffer */
00430         Buffer_Init(1);
00431         master_test[0] = 0xAA;
00432         master_test[1] = 0x55;
00433         slave_test[0] = 0x00;
00434         slave_test[1] = 0x00;
00435 
00436         /* Start I2C slave device first */
00437         transferSCfg.tx_data = Slave_Buf;
00438         transferSCfg.tx_length = sizeof(Slave_Buf);
00439         transferSCfg.rx_data = slave_test;
00440         transferSCfg.rx_length = sizeof(slave_test);
00441         I2C_SlaveTransferData(I2CDEV_S, &transferSCfg, I2C_TRANSFER_INTERRUPT);
00442 
00443         /* Then start I2C master device */
00444         transferMCfg.sl_addr7bit = I2CDEV_S_OWN_ADDR;
00445         transferMCfg.tx_data = master_test;
00446         transferMCfg.tx_length = sizeof(master_test);
00447         transferMCfg.rx_data = Master_Buf;
00448         transferMCfg.rx_length = sizeof(Master_Buf);
00449         transferMCfg.retransmissions_max = 3;
00450         I2C_MasterTransferData(I2CDEV_M, &transferMCfg, I2C_TRANSFER_INTERRUPT);
00451 
00452         /* Wait until both of them complete */
00453         while ((complete_M == RESET) || (complete_S == RESET));
00454         // verify data
00455         sp = Master_Buf;
00456         dp = Slave_Buf;
00457         for (tempp = sizeof(Master_Buf); tempp; tempp--){
00458                 if(*sp++ != *dp++){
00459                         _DBG_("Verify data error!");
00460                 }
00461         }
00462         // Success!
00463         if (tempp == 0){
00464                 _DBG_("Verify data successfully!");
00465         }
00466         sp = master_test;
00467         dp = slave_test;
00468         for (tempp = sizeof(master_test); tempp; tempp--){
00469                 if(*sp++ != *dp++){
00470                         _DBG_("Verify data error!");
00471                 }
00472         }
00473         // Success!
00474         if (tempp == 0){
00475                 _DBG_("Verify data successfully!");
00476         }
00477 #endif
00478 
00479         while (1){
00480                 tempp++;
00481         }
00482 
00483     /* Loop forever */
00484     while(1);
00485     return 1;
00486 }
00487 
00488 /* With ARM and GHS toolsets, the entry point is main() - this will
00489    allow the linker to generate wrapper code to setup stacks, allocate
00490    heap area, and initialize and copy code and data segments. For GNU
00491    toolsets, the entry point is through __start() in the crt0_gnu.asm
00492    file, and that startup code will setup stacks and data */
00493 int main(void)
00494 {
00495     return c_entry();
00496 }

00501 * @brief                Reports the name of the source file and the source line number
00502 *                               where the CHECK_PARAM error has occurred.
00503 * @param[in]    file Pointer to the source file name
00504 * @param[in]    line assert_param error line source number
00505 * @return               None
00506 *******************************************************************************/
00507 void check_failed(uint8_t *file, uint32_t line)
00508 {
00509         /* User can add his own implementation to report the file name and line number,
00510          ex: printf("Wrong parameters value: file %s on line %d\r\n", file, line) */
00511

00513         while(1);
00514 }
